title.narrative: 2.1.1: Early Child Development (ECD) FOR 2400 YOUNG CHILDREN

description.narrative: The capacity of 40 local communities are reinforced for ensuring the access to Early Child Development (ECD) centres for 24000 young children from 3 to 5 years old, which contributes to Early Learning, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2015, in the zones which registered low enrollment and a number of return refugees, at least 200,000 children, including girls and other vulnerable children school year old access to quality basic education

MINISTERE DE LA PROMOTION DE LA JEUNESSE ET DU SERVICE CIVIQUE

mailing-address.narrative: 18 Rue Pierre & Marie Currie Marcory Zone IV Boite Postale 443 Abidjan 04 Côte d'Ivoire

sector.narrative: Capacity development of ECD frontline workers
HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of parental education for school readiness (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary policy, leadership, and budget
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The capacity of 40 local communities are reinforced for ensuring the access to ECD centres for 24000 young children from 3 to 5years old

description.narrative: UNICEF, in partnership with Caritas, supported the establishment of seven ECD centers, thus bringing the number of supported ECD centers to 48 and provided 3,677 children (2,400 planned) with integrated services (health, nutrition, education) in 48 communities. This successful piloting has been introduced in the national education sector plan | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/01/2017

title.narrative: Number of children in community based ECD centers

baseline.value: 1477 children enrolled in 25 community-based early childhood development (ECD) centers

target.value: 2015:2400 new enrolled children in 40 new community based ECD centers

title.narrative: 2.Number of girls receiving school supplies in the targeted areas

baseline.value: Girls represent 46% of the total number of students

target.value: 2015:120,000 girls, i.e. 60% of the total number of primary school pupils receive school kits

actual.value: 2017:girls represent 47% of the total number of students enrolled in public primary schools.

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of policies on inclusive ECD covering particularly children with disabilities and other marginalized children
